Column Comment.0: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.1: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DATUM VELOCITY CORRECTION: The datum velocity correction applied to this
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: FIRST SAMPLE TIME: The timestamp at which the first sample record was made.
Column Comment.8: FIRST SAMPLE TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list oftimezones from www.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.9: HORIZONTAL SCALE: The horizontal scale used in the information item
Column Comment.11: PHASE: The phase of the product represented by the display segment.
Column Comment.12: POLARITY: The polarity of certain types of seismic information item.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: RECORD LENGTH: The length of the record for each trace. Denormalized fromSEIS_ACQTN_DESIGN.
Column Comment.16: REFERENCE DATUM: the reference datum to which this product has beencorrected. These columns are added only for cataloguing purposes so a recordsmanager does not have to create a processing set to catalogue a section. In addition,a static shift to a new elevation datum may be applied to the data only for outputpurposes. The proper place for this information is in SEIS PROC STEP and SEISPROC PARM
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.19: REPLACEMENT_VELOCITY: The replacement velocity used on this product. Thesecolumns are added only for cataloguing purposes so a records manager does nothave to create a processing set to catalogue a section. In addition, a static shift to anewelevation datum may be applied to the data only for output purposes. The properplace for this information is in SEIS PROC STEP and SEIS PROC PARM
Column Comment.21: REPORTED FIRST REFERENCE NUMBER: The first reference number associatedwith the seismic item that is being catalogued, such as a shot point number, tracenumber or file number.
Column Comment.22: REPORTED LAST REFERENCE NUMBER: The last reference number associatedwith the seismic item that is being catalogued, such as a shot point number, tracenumber or file number.
Column Comment.23: REPORTED REFERENCE NUMBER TYPE: The type of reference numberassociated with the seismic item that is being catalogued, such as a shot pointnumber, trace number or file number.
Column Comment.24: SAMPLE RATE: The interval between data samples. Denormalized fromSEIS_ACQTN_DESIGN.
Column Comment.26: SAMPLE TYPE: The type of sample that is captured in this product. Usually eithertime or depth.
Column Comment.27: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.28: STATIC CORRECTION: Often called statics, a bulk shift of a seismic trace in timeduring seismic processing. A common static correction is the weathering correction,which compensates for a layer of low seismic velocity material near the surfaceof theEarth. Other corrections compensate for differences in topography and differences inthe elevations of sources and receivers. (Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary)
Column Comment.30: VARIABLE AREA INDICATOR: a Y/N flag that iIndicates shading of the area underthe wiggle trace.
Column Comment.31: VERTICAL SCALE: The vertical scale used in some products, such as seismicsections.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.34: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.36: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.39: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
